#summary Built in demos, benchmarks and tutorials

==Built in Demos==
You can run demos in the <tt>pi</tt> with automatically generated scripts. To get started, run <tt>pi --demo</tt>. This shows you a list of available demos.
To generate an input file for a simple harmonic oscillator, type <code>pi --demo=SHO</code>. This generates an input file <tt>sho.xml</tt> which you can run with <code>pi sho.xml</code>.

Currently available demos include:
;     SHO            :      A simple harmonic oscillator
;     H_atom       :        A hydrogen atom
;     [[Helium Atom Demo| He_atom]]      :        A helium atom
;     spin              :   A single spin in a magnetic field
;     [[Quantum Wire Demo| wire]]               :  10 electrons in a quasi-1D GaAs (2D) wire
